title: Unbuckle my spine
excerpt: Unbuckle my spine, and / Unknot my tie, and / Throw my loose skin over the chairback.
fullText:
Unbuckle my spine, and
Unknot my tie, and
Throw my loose skin over the chairback.

And slide down to the toward an open mouth of a dark room
A crescent with foul breath, and chipped teeth,
And dried spittle in the crease,
A wound, rough shaped with fatal shears.

Then turn out the light, and
Return to their dreaming, and
Greet our lost grin in the mirror.
